Reviews.Title: “Fine for a couple of nights - but no more...”
Reviews.Author: jgreen78
Reviews.Content: Lift is antiquated, takes 3 people and all doors to be closed on each floor (pity not all guests fulfilled this requirement) Close to Baker Street tube - we walked from Kings Cross - took 45mins to hour. Room was small and just clean enough. Shame about noise from heater, and extractor fan throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: lyndon1965
Reviews.Content: Plus points Free Tea & coffee at all times (no facilities in room though) Location, short walk to Baker Street tube station Very good free Wifi Bad points Carpet was disgraceful dirty and badly stained everywhere Paintwork and general cleanliness was not good throughout hotel whole place felt dirty and looked shabby Breakfast was a joke an extremely limited selection and not sure how fresh the limited cold meat and eggs were Very bad and small lift which only went to third floor (we were on 4th) would only accomodate 2 people maximum and didnt always work (if people left door open you were unable to call the lift) Shower ran hot and cold, so one moment it was boiling hot the next it was freezing Dirty glasses and cups were not changed each day when room was cleaned All in all i do not feel that this hotel is worth the asking price

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: persejonh
Reviews.Content: When we arrive in hotel we have a trouble - receptionist said that our booking was canceled! We didn't do this but receptionist really can't find our reservation. He showed to us letter from our travel agent with cancellation. It was very late and thanks staff - he let us in our room. In the morning it was all fine with booking - receptionist settled all problems. So staff in this hotel very friendly. Also it's a great location - 5 min to Baker street tube. About 10 min to the Madam Tussauds museum and many else. Room was good and clean but nothing special. Breakfast was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, great location and good service.”
Reviews.Author: justliketetris
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a few days here and although when we arrived we were moved to a double room instead of the two singles we booked we had a good time. The service at the front desk was excellent. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “OK Place to Spend One Night, But Not More”
Reviews.Author: rtr2008
Reviews.Content: The Americana Hotel offers a reasonably priced hotel room in London. It won't be the fanciest room you've ever stayed in, but it's relatively inexpensive and it's clean. The single room consisted of one standard bed (on the firmer side, but fine) and a bathroom with a small shower. As other reviewers have noted, the carpet was quite worn -- especially in the hallways -- but my room at least was spotless. In terms of amenities, the Americana offers free WiFi that's fast & reliable. You can access the WiFi in the hotel lobby as well as in your room. They also serve a modest but sufficient continental breakfast and offer free coffee & hot chocolate throughout the day. Some unexpectedly nice touches, given the price. The Americana is located a block away from London Business School and Regents Park. It's within a five minute walk to the Baker Street tube station where you'll find plenty of shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “great price for great value”
Reviews.Author: CristiDan
Reviews.Content: booked 5 nights and I wasn't so sure about this hotel but when i got the I was glad I've booked it rooms are good clean, medium size, services OK, staff was helpful, it was a great choice. 5 min from the Tube

Reviews.Title: “For London this hotel was fine”
Reviews.Author: ashni
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location about 7 or 8 min walk form Baker Street station and set on a quiet street but only a few mins walk to shops and restaurants. Also Lords cricket stadium is very close by. In saying this the location is the hotels saving grace. I stayed here for 3 nights as a birthday treat for my mum. The room was very small and very basic however it was clean and as weren't planning on spending a great deal of time in it fine for what we wanted. There is no tea or coffee making facilities in the room and whilst there is a drinks machine down in the lobby area this was regularly broke. The breakfast was a waste of time most stuff was gone by 08.00 and it is not replenished -including bread!! What was available wasn't very appetising. Staff were fine not very chatty and the breakfast woman was quite abrupt and sharp but this balanced itself out with a friendly night porter. The stairs up to the rooms were very narrow and the lift even more so. it was an old lift which was very noisy and really only held one person with a suitcase. All in all for London this hotel was adequate and I didn't experience anything unbearable. I have started to stay in studio/apartment style accommodation in London as it gives a bit of extra space and ultimately comes in at similar prices to the 3 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Boycebabe
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worse pklace I have ever stayed. I booked it for a theatre break with my daughter as a treat and we came back totally exhausted. The rooms and the hotel in general is shabby and the rooms tiny. We asked for a twin room and got a double but this didn't matter as we couldn't sleep from the noise of the traffic and the very hot room. We were given a twin for our last night but as the window was dangerous we had to keep it closed. The double room was so small that I had to squeeze past the hand basin to get into the shower and the bedroom tiny. However the beds were clean. The staff are pleasant and helpful, the wi-fi free, the breakfast ok but this hotel is overpriced even for a buget hotel. If you have children avoid as there is a danger of them falling out of the window. We travelled with two overnight bags and a laptop bag and only one of us could get into the lift with our luggage as it was so small. to sum up. noisy, dirty, overpriced and uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money...”
Reviews.Author: Beachy022
Reviews.Content: The Americana has lovely communal areas and provides a great breakfast. Love the old lift :) Rooms are good if not a little shabby round the edges, could do with a lick of paint on the skirtings, but thats really only if youre being picky. Would definately stay again as its central at a very reasonable price... :)

Reviews.Title: “About average”
Reviews.Author: ideamatei
Reviews.Content: First the good thing: Location is great: 5 minutes walk to Madame Tussauds or 15 minutes walk to Oxford Street. Breakfast is decent, nothing special but enough. The staff is friendly and helpful. You can have free tee or coffee all day long. There is a computer in the lobby and wi-fi throughout the hotel. Now, the ‘not so good’… the rooms are not cleaned as often as they should be. The towels are not changed, having a strange smell. The carpet on the floor is dirty, having several stains. The door handle was broken. On our first day, there was a tiny spider on the bed cover. The elevator is small, noisy and claustrophobic. As a conclusion, the hotel is not very bad; however there is definitely room for improvement. If it was cleaner it would have been much better. Maybe even reaching a 3 star level…

Reviews.Title: “a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: carina77
Reviews.Content: This was really the worst hotel we've ever stayed in, the dirtiest, the shabbiest. We've arrived after a night flight, one hour before check in time, only to be told in the rudest manner possible that there were no rooms ready yet. We came back a couple of hours later to what I call a nightmare of a room, extremely small, no room to turn around, dirty, broken door and window. The lamest excuse for a breakfast buffee. The staff was rude, not willing to help me with a simple information as the timetable of the bus stopping in front of the hotel. really, unheard of before. The only good point is its location, but with the fantastic underground web of London, there is really no problem if you stay a little further from center town. Accomodation at Americana Hotel almost spoiled our first time visit to London. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Does the job for an overnight business stay.”
Reviews.Author: peteandjonny Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Whilst I would not choose to stay here for leisure, it is fine for an overnight business stay with a tight budget. The hotel is in a good location (between Baker Street and Marylebone tube stations) and the room itself was well appointed with a TV, good shower and comfy bed. The decor is standard and the whilst the carpets have seen better days, they are clean enough. A continental breakfast is included but there are no tea/coffee facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: StevenMather
Reviews.Content: The Americana hotel is a nice, friendly, conveniently located hotel. We thought the room was on the small side but not tiny. It was very frustrating that there did not seem to be enough hot water each morning despite showers at 7am. The carpets seemed a but dirty throughout, could do with a deep clean! Breakfast is good, croissants, ham, tomato, cereal, yoghurts, tea coffee etc. Staff seem really nice and friendly and the location was great for Regents College.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem for short weekend trips and couples, 100% recommended!”
Reviews.Author: decph
Reviews.Content: Was a winner from the off as it was so easy to find, got the EasyBus from the airport to Baker St and the hotel is no more than 400m around the corner from the tube station. On the short walk from the station we quickly realized what a good location it was, passing several cafes and restaurants and even a 24hour Tesco Express. As for the actual hotel, the rooms are small but are very comfortable and modern to make up for it. Perfect for a young couple where all you need is a bed, a TV, a table and a bathroom. The complimentary breakfast was delicious with everything you could ask fro in a continental breakfast included hard and soft boiled eggs. Finally it is no more than £10 taxi to any of the usual shopping or tourist spots. Seriously recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful staff in a small, but comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janjon10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy walking distance to subway. Staff were so pleasant to deal with and eager to help in anyway. They went above and beyond to make our short stay enjoyable. Room was small but pleasantly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says”
Reviews.Author: Happyone86
Reviews.Content: Check in was okay. It is very convenient for public transport. The room is small, clean and functional. I would have liked tea making facilites but you can have these if you travel to reception area. It is on four floors but lift only serves three, I am mobile so this was no problem i was asked if i mind,i appreciated being asked,it is not a problem. Checkout was quick. You can leave your bags if you like. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location ok, but the cleanliness poor in rooms, need refurb desperately”
Reviews.Author: LeollB
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly and helpful, breakfast ok. However the rooms and hallways in most of the hotel need either cleaning thoroughly, or pull it all out and start again. We travelled throuhout Uk and Europe and there was no hotel that was as so dirty as this one. Don't go there, until they refurbish this place.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel”
Reviews.Author: paty1234
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really old and the breakfast was so scarce, same every day, you didn' have much of a choice. Not so many restaurants around just a Tesco shop. It was 6 min away from the metro station which was probabily the only good thing about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & location, pretty bad service”
Reviews.Author: Berglind
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Americana Hotel for 4 nights in January. When we arrived (pretty late) there were two young girls (about 17-18 years old) at the reception chatting and laughing very loudly which didn't bother me but they didn't look or act very professional e.g. I had to ask them about the breakfast times and it also took them some time to figure out where the next supermarket was. The other staff that we met was very nice and helpful but unfortunately these girls seemed to have a lot of shifts while we stayed there. We got a room on the top floor which meant we had to take the tiny elevator up to the 3rd or 4th floor and walk the rest with our bags. The room itself was tiny but clean and very reasonable for the price. The location is very good, only about 5 min walk to Baker Street tube station. The breakfast was very basic, some white bread and yogurts. For a budget London hotel it is very good and reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jackie_H_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and found the Americana excellent value and very pleasant. The room was small, and in a different building from the reception and dinning room. However we were shown to our room and it wasn't a problem for us. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. We requested an early breakfast and this was not a problem. The hotel is very well situated and lovely and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: HawkMD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Americana, Jan. 2009, for a 4 day getaway. The hotel served our needs for a warm bed not too far from the underground. The breakfast was okay and the hotel seemed busy. The staff served their purpose but seemed a bit disinterested most of the time. All in all, the hotel was just adequate but served our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: bhusawal
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel. Location is great. Hotel itself is not recommended. Rooms are very dirty. Carpet not cleaned for months. Bathroom shower stall is 2 feet by 2 feet and very uncomfortable. Lobby area is ok. Breakfast is reasonable though the city's garbage cleaners come and have breakfast everyday. Staff is helpful but very limited in experience and expertise. Bottom line NOT RECOMMENDED

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: shewchuk316
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel very last minute and were a little apprehensive because of some of the reviews. The hotel had a great location near the tube station. Our room was small but very clean. The main floor was decorated nicely and had a continental breakfast room that served cereal, yogurt, eggs, croissants, toast, coffee and juice. The carpet in the halls and rooms could use replacing as it is worn and dirty looking but you could see that it was vacuumed everyday. If all you want is a clean hotel room to sleep in that has a great location, then this hotel will be perfect for you.

Reviews.Title: “Needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: rmaustrav
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived and had to upgrade our room as we couldn't get two suitcases in the standard double room. Paid extra and upgraded to twin room, very dirty carpet and had smell. Bathroom okay, had been refurbished to an average standard. Breakfast room and lounge were great recently refurbed but after proceeding through to accommodation levels, very shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Please Avoid”
Reviews.Author: JimmyJ29
Reviews.Content: A group of us were booked to stay hear by a third party and it was terrible. The rooms were really expensive, dirty, in need of repair and generally falling apart. There were smashed cups left on the star way the lift woke us up everyday. Please adoid!!!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: L0ved_L0nd0n
Reviews.Content: I will never stay in that hotel ever again!! We suppose to stay there for a week but we only stayed for 3 days .There was no hot water cause they had a problem with a bump! ok it could happen anywhere ,right? The problem was that they didn't even care for 2 days that we ask about hot water and they keep saying that will fix it!! After the 2 days they couldn't do anything as the manager said!! I tried for 2 hours via internet to find another hotel and they didn't even ask if we needed any help !! The only good thing is that they gave us back half the money we paid! + small rooms+small elevator + poor breakfast

Reviews.Title: “A Good Budget Hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: fr21555
Reviews.Content: The Americana is very convenient to the Underground, close to Baker Street. It's a good choice for those spending their time in central London and require basic accomodations. The rooms we had were VERY small, as were the bathrooms. On the upside is the price. You can do a lot worse in central London- I have. The rooms we had were quiet, as they faced a back alleyway away from the street side of the hotel. No view but we only needed a place to sleep for a couple of nights and this place filled the bill pretty well at a reasonable price. There's a breakfast buffet in the morning and the coffee/tea maker is always available. No free wi-fi here and the cost for it was ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money if on shopping trip”
Reviews.Author: M-P7
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel early December with my daughter. Over on business and also shopping for the Christmas. This hotel is small and very basic but perfect for us over doing shopping and keeping the expenses down. Situated just five minutes walk from Baker Street station. The staff were friendly and the hotel was lovely and warm which is what we needed with the weather being so cold outside. The room was adequate, in dire need of updating; carpet old and stained but the beds were spotless and the room was big enough. The bathroom was spotless and clean towels were issued every day we were there. The price included a breakfast which we found excellent. We are not big eaters in the morning so getting something to eat thrown in with the price was a bonus for us. We could eat as much as we wanted so you wouldn't be hungry starting off the day. If you are just visiting for a short time and want good value for money this is your hotel. If you are looking for lavishness then find another place to stay and pay the huge prices. All one wants is a clean, warm, friendly, good value hotel when doing some retail therapy. Would definitely return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Merrypup
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in December 2009. I sifted through loads of similar ones nearby with horror, so I didn't expect much at the excellent price we paid. However this lovely hotel was nothing like that. The staff were great and very helpful, we got a map from reception with a discount code on which we used many times. The room was on the top floor and must have been recenlty refurbished as it all looked new. It was warm and clean with fresh towels daily. The main areas and breakfast room were decorated nicely, breakfast was a continental help yourself! Coffee etc is available all day which was a nice touch. I was tempted not to give a review and to keep this place to myself but they deserve the business, we will be back there in March. Just a note.... it is almost directly behind the Sherlock Holmes Museum very near to Baker Street tube.

Reviews.Title: “Worth trying if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: NorthWestRosie Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location near to Baker Street. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms are small but fine if you just need a bed for the night also beware noisy neighbours. Complimentary breakfast included and a decent enough selection to choose from to start yor day, also tea, coffee, chocolate available from machine in lounge all the time we needed it. Room clean and towels changed for our second day there. Not sure if I would pay full rate but I got a good deal so I felt I got good value.

Reviews.Title: “lovely and clean and modern place to stay in London centre”
Reviews.Author: beachmadam
Reviews.Content: close to Madame Tussauds in London, Baker street the rooms are small but all essentials are great and clean and the staff is super friendly breakfast is plentiful ( but if you like some boiled eggs come quick!) tea/coffee machines in the lobby - 24 hours I was very happy staying there

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: IvetAngelova
Reviews.Content: Pros - close to Baker Street tube station, which makes its location perfect for tourism; very good continental breakfast; polite staff; quiet room (we got a backside one); good shower; nice area; reasonable price for Central London. Cons - tiny room, miniature bathroom; dirty carpet all through the hotel (it definitely needs to be replaced); they really need to care a bit more about cleanliness. Overall it was a pleasant experience, I would recommend the Americana for a few days stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: mrkute
Reviews.Content: the hotel was really pleasant and comfortable.. close to center and underground .the hotel offered drinks tea/coffee as and when you wanted them, the room was modern and bright...we enjoyed our time here and would defo go back highly recomended we booked through octopus travel online and got great deal £153 for 2 nights b&b(continental) for the 2 of us. parking is just 100 yards from hotel..ncp but quite pricey at £30 per day.. but it is central london!!!

Reviews.Title: “Americana”
Reviews.Author: ericgEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Americana for three days in august. The location of the hotel is great, just a short 5 minute walk to Baker street underground. Good breakfast,free coffee all day & night. Smallish rooms but clean enough. The only thing it needs is a repaint of the walls which are looking a bit shabby. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as I expected”
Reviews.Author: Nasser_H
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a very good location. The staff are polite and friendly. Breakfast is great. However the rooms are too small and tight you can't find a place for you suite-case !! I would recommend it for a one day stopover. but for long stays I wouldn't stay there again as you can find cheaper hotels for bigger rooms! the back rooms are more quit! the front rooms are too noisy because of the busy street. try to get a backside room.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms disapointing and in need of updating”
Reviews.Author: catanmax
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Americana hotel for a weekend, and I booked it after looking at reviews here and on other sites, also the price was excellent and the location seemed ideal. The room was very disapointing, on first look, it seemed nice until we turned the light on. The carpet was dirty, not that anything was on it, it was obvious it had been hoovered, but it was in bad need of shampooing, most of the carpets throughout the halls were the same. The blind, which had a leaf pattern which resembled a hash plant didn't go up, so lights always had to be on. The bathroom was small, the shower door, which was well worn, just about opened enough for me to get through and tiles were broken on the floor and the walls. It was in great need of updating. Unfortunately the room we stayed in must have either previously been a smoking room or was above a yard used by smoking employees as a stale smoke smell lingered in the room at all times. Also when we stayed it was very hot in London and that didn't help the stuffiness of the room. Apart from that I couldn't fault anything else, plus points, the staff were friendly, the hotel breakfast was fine, the location was excellent, just a few minutes walk to Baker Street tube station and ten minutes walk from Oxford Street. I wouldn't stay at the Americana again, unless I knew the rooms had been updated, if you don't mind the above I would say stay there, but for no longer than a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointing considering all the good reviews”
Reviews.Author: nicichan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Americana with a friend for 2 nights in June, I had booked this hotel based on its good reviews. The location of the hotel is perfect, it's really close to the Baker St tube station and there's a few shops and pubs near the hotel too. The website where we booked didn't specify between twin and double room, but I asked for a twin room in my booking. When we got there, we got a double room at the back of the hotel. It was tiny and stuffy, didn't seem very clean and the toilet flush wasn't working. Based on this room, I would have rated this hotel at a 1, we were very disappointed. We spoke to the guy at reception (who was very friendly) if we could get a different room, but unfortunately they were booked out that night, but he offered to give us a different room on the following day. The second room we got was a twin room and it was a lot bigger and nicer. Everything was working fine and we were happy enough. Both of the rooms could've done with a lick of paint though. Breakfast was OK. I'm not sure if I'd really stay there again, but it's good value and in a great location, so if you're only going to stay for a few nights it should be grand.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a short stay in London”
Reviews.Author: SeashellsHG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Americana in July 2009. We had 5 days to see the sights and the Americana was a perfect base with the Baker Street and Marylebone stations only a few minutes' stroll away. Having Regents Park so close is lovely and there are several pubs and restaurants nearby (The Volunteer pub was a great find!) We had a room at the rear of the hotel which was really quiet - unexpected for London. The bed was really comfortable, room was clean and the bathroom small but with a good shower. Breakfast was adequate. We would stay here again on our next visit to London. My only suggestion would be a kettle and teabags for a late night or early morning cuppa.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant-would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: DevonTraveller12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights whilst in town for the LIMS show. Lovely clean foyer, excellent fresh continental breakfast, free drinks from the lobby, polite staff, very secure. Great location for tourism, being about a 5 minute walk from Baker Street tube station. Room was on the small side but inconsequential as we were out until midnight every night. Clean bathroom, safes fitted in rooms. Lift stops on the 3rd floor and is small, so beware if carrying large amounts of luggage. Quite a lot of traffic noise at the front due to location on main road but this didn't affect our sleep. On the basis of our stay, I would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a real find!”
Reviews.Author: SOLONorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: this is a great little hotel tucked away behind baker st.the rooms are lovely and clean with beautiful decor.The staff are superb,nothing is too much trouble.As a single woman traveller I felt very safe in this hotel.I will DEFINITELY stay here again when in London.I do hope this hotel keeps its lovely atmosphere and dosent resort to any gimmicks to raise their profile.Stay just as you are!!/

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: gimliAntwerp
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days.Very close to all important things to see in London, the undergrond only 10 minutes away (very easy to use).Staff very very friendly, room small but OK and very clean.Over all, it was a very very good long weekend.Would sertenly come back to the same hotel on a next trip.Tumbs up !!A lot of thanks to the staff of the hotel, hope you read this reaview to :-)Belgium greats you all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cheap price for London”
Reviews.Author: Trisha48
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location close to Baker Street Station and Regent's Park. It's also walking distance to St Pancras (15 minutes) where the Eurostar leaves from. My room was a good size and quite comfortable. The complimentary tea, coffee, hot chocolate etc from the coffee machine is a lovely added touch. And the price was cheap for such a central location in London.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - especially for location and price”
Reviews.Author: eakennedy
Reviews.Content: This is a small bed and breakfast style location in an excellent location just 5 minutes walk from Baker Street Tube station and near everything in London. I recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to London on a budget. I stayed in the hotel for 5 nights after an extended trip to Egypt. The rooms are small but extremely quiet, tons of hot water, excellent spa bath products and an amazing staff with buffet breakfast included. The front desk is open 24hrs. There are many excellent reviews on this hotel already so I won't go on...I'll just say that I agree with every positive comment and have absolutely nothing negative to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home...”
Reviews.Author: coachmims
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights at the Americana recently and was very pleased by the accommodations, the helpful and friendly staff as well as the convenient location. On a previous trip to the UK in 2006, I stayed in several reputable hotels in Earls Court. The rooms in the Americana were larger with better storage areas and new flat screen televisions, and personally I felt like the Regent's Park/Baker Street area was a more desirable place to stay...and the room rate was actually a few quid less! The en suite bathrooms were also larger and well appointed. I extended my stay there for a day and later returned after a week of travel to stay for another day before my flight home. Finally, everyone who worked there was cordial no matter the time of day or night that I encountered them, and helpful to me for local information. This was definitely not the case in several of the other hotels I have encountered, many of which put restrictions on the times you can come and go. I would recommend this hotel to any American traveler who is looking for a good value in a safe comfortable and convenient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed overall but plenty of positives.”
Reviews.Author: Superkev1970
Reviews.Content: Just come back from the Americana. I would have rated 7/10 but my good lady thought 5 at first but then 6 by departure. Pros; Location- close to Baker Street tube, 10 mins walk from Oxford Street/ Hyde Park, 2 mins walk to Regents Park. Very pleasant staff- complained about pokey double room so they gave us a nicer twin in the basement with no cafuffle. Bathrooms nice and modern with mosaic tiling. Reception area very nice with free coffee (not great, mind!), tea and apples- nice touch. Breakfast an ample continental with boiled eggs and a choice of cooked meats. Cons; First room tiny, once you get past the reception area, the light colour carpets and decor is not in a good state- in need of attention soon! Our second room was more spacious but walls and carpets badly marked, ceiling marked (!?), lots of cobwebs and bathroom a little grimy in the "hard to get" areas. I would go back, my good lady would at a push but she would prefer to return to the Astor Court if available. Highlights of break? Dinner at Langhans Bistro (fab) and late night kebabs from the peculiar kebab shop just over the road from hotel (small but incredibly tasty with home-made chips!).

Reviews.Title: “very good decision to stay in americana”
Reviews.Author: chennaipattu
Reviews.Content: the real reason for myself to chose americana hotel is to stay close to the venue where I had a very important appointment the following day and I required a good night sleep. Inspite of being in the heart of London, it was very quiet and my room was very neat and tidy. The automatic coffee machine was an asset for the place making a coffee so easy. The gentleman who was at the reception was very kind and helpful as well. The breakfast was very good and served well. Overall for the purpose of my visit and stay I can't ask for anything more and it served its purpose more than anticipated. I am sure that I will be staying again in this hotel if I have an important venture in London. Excellent for a single person staying for official business and possibly for anybody who wants to stay in the heart of the city but a quiet and neat place.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevg268
Reviews.Content: Just came back after saying 3 nights here. What can I say about this place? Firstly it's in a great location, safe and easy access to town. The room is tiny but as we only stayed in the room to sleep, I have no complaints. The shower room was small also ,but the shower was fantastic, powerful and hot. The breakfast was lovely and the place was clean. the staff were very helpful. Overall I really loved this place and will return here again. The only thing that stopped me rating this hotel the highest was that it need a coat of paint and new carpets but I have stayed in far more expensive hotels and which were not a patch on this place.

Reviews.Title: “great location and super clean”
Reviews.Author: kevintaxis
Reviews.Content: Been in the Americana hotel for 4 nights .Cannot fault it .The rooms are normall for london quite small but do the job . The location is absolutly fantastic 3 stops by the underground from Oxford circus . Hotel staff were really friendly .Cannot do enought for you .Highly recomanded .Will go back

Reviews.Title: “The price is right.”
Reviews.Author: DarrenFiander
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel over the internet a couple of weeks ago - after hearing several good reviews about the accommodation. From the outside I must admit it didn't really look much. However stepping into the hotel itself proved to be a pleasant surprise The lounge and reception were clean with a modern touch and the staff were more than helpful. . Upon receiving the room keys, my partner and myself made our way up to our room (on the upper floor). Instead of opting to walk the flight of stairs we decided to take the hilariously match boxed sized lift - which added to the character of the hotel if anything, not to mention it also gave us a good laugh! Getting into the room was a problem, however this was only because of my inability to use door keys! Luckily a lovely room cleaner came to our aid. The room itself was clean, modern and everything you could ask for considering the amount of money being paid - in short it had all the essentials (En Suite, Freeview T.V, Landline Phone, Wi Fi & Hair Dryer). Breakfast was simple continental breakfast which served its purpose just fine and offered enough variety. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel anyone looking to go to London on budget - you won't be disappointed. Forgot to also mention it is literally 2-5 minutes from Marylebone and Baker Street stations with various shopping outlets and food chains scattered around. Would stay again and recommend to friends/family. I'd also advise anyone to London to grab some tickets to Blood Brothers at the Phoenix Theatre - a fantastic show!

Reviews.Title: “Typical tourist hotel in overpriced London”
Reviews.Author: Tanapat
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in this hotel. Rooms quite small, but very clean and within easy distance of Regents Park, Baker Street and other transport. Okay for a night or two and doubtless a typical tourist class hotel in over priced London.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: sadieIreland
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a mid week break in London. Really liked the townhouse style of hotel and its great location near Baker street tube station and Madam Tussauds. Tour buses also go from the area. The hotel itself has a few down points, as other reviewers have noted. The Carpets! where do I begin... They are in a bad state. If they replaced them this would be a really nice hotel. We had booked a twin room for two nights but they only had a double, so they offered us another room free of charge, which was very nice considering we weren't bothered. Bathrooms very clean and modern. Rooms are small but do the job. They offer really nice tea/coffee all day in reception which is a nice touch after a long day sight seeing. Would recommend it for its location and price but wish they'd just get new carpets!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice.”
Reviews.Author: Anthalei
Reviews.Content: Nice area with few shops and restaurants and very nice parc across. Easy access to the underground. Breakfast was nice. Cheese, toast, croissants. Toilets are very nice, which room also is. All in all really nice hotel. :D

Reviews.Title: “Good location - pity about the racket”
Reviews.Author: IrelandLiam
Reviews.Content: Room was tiny & very basic, but was clean. Great location - 5 mins walk to Baker St underground which will get you to most places easily. Oxford Street about 20 mins walk. For the price, it was fine but beware if you like to lie-in of a morning - building work next door was very loud & started about 8.00 every morning. Likely to be going on for next few months..

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: PinhoeMan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Americana on business on several occasions during 2007. The hotel is in a nice location, close to the tube (Baker Street about a 5 min walk). For a small, comfortable hotel in central London, I think this hotel is very good value. I've stayed in several different rooms and found each to be clean well laid-out and functional. The bathrooms, although small (and minus a bath!) are clean and modern; the water is hot throughout the day. The breakfast is continental buffet style but there's a reasonable choice and as much as you want. I've never had a problem checking in or out. Things that could put off some visitors: 1. it's on a busy road and anyone staying at the front of the hotel WILL hear traffic noise; 2. there's no restaurant so you'll have to eat out or bring something back (Tesco is only just down the road) 3. the TV gets tuned from the reception desk; you can't do it from your room. Every time I've stayed I've only had 4 channels on the TV but different ones each time - can be annoying if you'd planned to watch football on ITV and there isn't an ITV. Reception can sort this out though.

Reviews.Title: “Fine location, nich bathrooms..”
Reviews.Author: DanishTurist
Reviews.Content: Very bright ( on 3.th floor), but small rooms. Very good closetspace!, and very beautyfull new bathrooms, amazingly big, The carpet all over was looking very dirty, and as other rewiers, we found some dirt under the bed that wasn´t ousr! A very big shame, cause expect from that, it would be a perfect place, to that price! Practical location, only 4 minutes walk from the easy-bus stop, and Bakerstreet subway, and close to oxford street.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: erinkim
Reviews.Content: Tiny room, but the toilet was good. I can't understand why they don't have a TV remote controler. To turn TV off, you should move from your bed. The staffs were kind, but not that much bright. Everything was so-so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for high-priced London”
Reviews.Author: aml9020
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. I did a ton of research on trip advisor until I found the best hotel for less than $150 a day that didn't look or sound absolutely disgusting. Once we found the hotel our experience was great (we took the long route, but it's really only 2 blocks from the tube). The desk attendant was helpful and efficient. When we asked for a fan for the room he had one there when we returned. The room looked just like the pictures I saw on here. It was small but not claustrophobic, clean, and nicely decorated. The only problem we had was the shower did not work the first time we tried to use it. We called the front desk which did not seem that surprised to hear about our problem. However, within 15 minutes someone came down and fixed and we didn't have any other problems. The continental breakfast was excellent. Not only was there a coffee machine, there was juice, milk, cereal, yogurt, fruit, croissants, rolls, toast, deli meats and cheeses. This is a great, relatively inexpensive hotel for overpriced London and I would absolutely stay there again and look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Laura P
Reviews.Content: We (me and my fiancé) stayed in Hotel Americana in London from 3 Sep to 5 Sep 2007. Hotel room was really small, but tidy and surprisingly modern considering .. ;-). Reasonably priced hotels in London can be really dodgy and located far away from transport network. Staff was helpful, breakfast was okay and location was great!Only a couple of minutes walk from Baker Street tube station and a bus station across the street. So even the tube strike couldn't ruin our stay...Even though hotel was located near main streets of the area, there was no noise. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends, when they visit London :-).

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Customer”
Reviews.Author: ta1951
Reviews.Content: We found and booked the Americana at short notice relying on website reviews and were not disappointed. Walking distance from the Bakerloo tube station with an adequate number of bars and eateries nearby. Nicely renovated checkin with adjacent lounge and breakfast room. Our two rooms were not overly spacious or low in price, but it is London. However they were clean and comfortable and adequately fitted out, and there was an elevator. Included breakfast was not quite the full-English, but still a good standard. A well-presented hotel with friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good little find”
Reviews.Author: Swind0n
Reviews.Content: Brilliant little hotel - we stayed one night while attending a concert and 5 mins walk from Bakerloo line, the hotel was clean, en-suite had just been done out and it looked like the room had been too. Staff very friendly on reception, would definately recommend if going to London - we will definately use again!!

Reviews.Title: “really nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mandi1
Reviews.Content: What a lovely small hotel. Such a find in London when a lot of the smaller places are awful. The staff were really friendly and helpful. Rooms were quite small but were tastefully decorated and had a flat screen TV. The bathroom was very pleasant and the large overhead rainshower very boutique. The breakfast was plentiful and lots of choice, the lounge area with free tea and coffee very modern. The only very minor downsides for me were: A bit noisy when staying on the fourth floor above the street ( between 7 am and 11 pm). The room was very hot due to the temperature in London during my stay, no air conditioning but a large window (a nice area outside the window to sit if you can get out there). This hotel is in a really nice area, it is quite upmarket and felt safe at night for two females travelling alone. I will definately return here again, its one of the best 3* I have stayed at in London. Compare this to the 5* Russell square, rooms were smaller but service and food much better. This hotel is quite central and its easy to get around with 2 tube stations so close.

Reviews.Title: “Really VERY pleased with my stay”
Reviews.Author: lolly-UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night in the Americana, but I was very impressed. Yes, the room was small, but very well laid out and furnished in light colours so it didn't seem claustrophobic. The bathroom, although again small, had a very good overhead 'rain' style shower, as well as a standard fitting. Breakfast was good. The lounge area is a real bonus for a 3* hotel, and the free tea or coffee a lovely touch. It would seem the bad reviews here are mostly from a couple of years ago. The hotel has been renovated since then, and is now of a standard to compete with hotels in the higher rating categories. I'll have no hesitation staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “careful!”
Reviews.Author: Marc86
Reviews.Content: Please don't use a credit card at this hotel. I stay in there for 3 nights in april 21-24. When I did my check-in I presented a VISA, just for a PRE authorization, since at that time I was not sure about the method of payment (cash, credit card). When I checked-out on april 24 I decide to use another card, an American express, instead of the VISA. All the debts were charged to that AMEX card. Nevertheless, when I checked my cards balance, I verified that THEY BILLED BOTH OF THEM!!!! I had an enormous headache dealing wtih VISA and AMEX trying to cancel the undue debt. Therefore, there was a large bad faith and actually robbery. My advice: if you had to stay at this hotel, pay cash.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: epimetheus10
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Americana. We were there at the end of March and stayed for four nights. The staff were all very nice. The room was small, but pleasant, and the location was excellent. It's within two blocks of two different tube stations. It's also on a quiet street, but near several good restaurants and pubs. Everything was very clean and comfortable. This is a great hotel for the budget-minded. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: anny.metaxas
Reviews.Content: Best location in a peaceful area in the heart of London. A boutique hotel , a very cosy lobby - sitting room with a variety of complimentary coffee / tea .Very very clean and warm rooms recently renovated so everything is brand new. Amazed with continental breakfast which included juice,all kind of coffee , tea , selection of cereals , bread , croisants. Also fruit , yoghourt ,cheese , ham, smoked turkey , boiled eggs etc Above all the people that were very friendly , profesional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: depi
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice experience staying at Americana Hotel. The staff is available anytime you need them , always willing to help with any information you require. The location is great, just 10 min walk from Oxford Street and 3 min from Bakers Street underground station from which you can easily move around the city. Rooms are very clean. You can enjoy complimentary coffee, tea anytime in the "warm" lobby area. We also found breakfast to be very satisfying. Room rates are very reasonable. Surely would enjoy using the same hotel during our next stay in London ! D. Petrou/S. Christodoulou Cyprus

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tillotson
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Americana Hotel. The hotel has a very pleasant lobby area where breakfast is served and where complimentary hot drinks are available throughout the day. The double room we had was small but was clean and tidy, towels changed each day and the staff on reception were helpful and friendly. The hotel is very conveniently located a few minutes walk from Baker Street Tube Station. This is a budget hotel and for the price was good value for money. Car Parking is available outside of the hotel during the night but the NCP car parks nearby are expensive to use during the day.

Reviews.Title: “good location, decent price”
Reviews.Author: someone101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel just after it had been refurbished and are very satisfied about the new standard (especially the brand new bathrooms are nice). The rooms vary in size, you can barely turn around in some of the bathrooms, however, we were lucky to get a room with a large bathroom. Rooms have small LCD TVs which lacks international stations, unfortunately. The staff is available 24/7 and is very friendly and helpful. Nice breakfast and complimentary tea/coffee/etc is available at any time. Good location, decent pricing.

HotelInfo.Name: Americana Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 172 Gloucester Place | Regents Park, London NW2 6DS, England
